abstract: Goldman Sachs‘s Arjun N. Murti remembers the pain of the oil shocks of the 1970s. But he is bracing for something far worse now: He foresees a “super spike” – a price surge that will soon drive crude oil to $200 a barrel.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs‘s Arjun N. Murti remembers the pain of the oil shocks of the 1970s. But he is bracing for something far worse now: He foresees a “super spike” – a price surge that will soon drive crude oil to $200 a barrel.

headline.main: An Oracle of Oil Predicts $200-a-Barrel Crude
